faq.metaDescription: Frequently asked questions about Kaynar Law Firm and general guidance.
faq.heading: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: The information below is general; each file must be assessed according to its own circumstances.

items.question: How do I issue a power of attorney?
items.answer: A notarised power of attorney is required. Its scope depends on the legal process to be handled and the procedure is completed with identification documents such as an ID card or passport.

items.question: How can I learn the hearing date?
items.answer: You may obtain the date and time from the court registry, the e-Justice (UYAP) portal or through your lawyer. Monitoring the file is essential because hearing dates can change.

items.question: How do service of process and deadlines work?
items.answer: The Law on Notifications and related regulations apply. The date of proper service usually starts the clock for statutory deadlines, which may vary depending on the legislation.

items.question: Can I view my case file through UYAP?
items.answer: Parties to a case may view portions of the file on the UYAP citizen portal. Access may be restricted if the file is subject to a confidentiality order.

aydinlatma.metaDescription: Information on how Kaynar Law Firm processes personal data.
aydinlatma.title: Data Protection Notice
aydinlatma.description: As Kaynar Law Firm, we safeguard your personal data in accordance with the Personal Data Protection Law (Law No. 6698). The information below applies to website visitors, individuals who complete the contact form and job applicants.

sections.title: 1. Data Controller
body: Data controller: Kaynar Law Firm. Contact: contact@kaynarhukuk.com, +905369495345. Address: Merkezefendi Mah. Mevlana Cad. A-8 Blok Kat:11 Daire:47, 34040 Istanbul.

sections.title: 2. Visitor Data
body: The following data may be processed when you visit our website:
list: IP address, browser details and log records
sections.note: Purposes: ensuring site security, measuring performance and managing preferences. Legal grounds: Law No. 5651, legitimate interest, explicit consent (for statistical/functional cookies).

sections.title: 3. Contact Form Data
body: The name, surname, phone number, e-mail address and message submitted via the form are processed solely to respond to your request.

Legal grounds: Attorneyship Law, PDPL Article 5/2(c) (establishment or performance of a contract) and Article 5/2(f) (legitimate interest). Explicit consent is obtained where required. Data is stored in encrypted systems and not shared with third parties.

sections.title: 4. Job Application Data
body: CVs and application documents are stored for the duration of the evaluation. Data shared with consent is not disclosed to third parties without authorisation.

sections.title: 5. Retention and Transfers
body: Visitor logs are retained for two years pursuant to Law No. 5651; contact requests are stored for the response period plus three years; job applications are kept for up to two years. No international transfer takes place unless legally mandatory.

sections.title: 6. Data Subject Rights
body: Under PDPL Article 11 you have the right to learn whether data is processed, to access, correct, erase and object. Applications can be made through the methods described on the Data Subject Application page and will be answered within 30 days.

sections.title: 7. Updates
body: This notice may be updated when necessary. The most recent version is available at {siteUrl}/kvkk/aydinlatma.

cerezPolitikasi.description: The cookie categories used on the Kaynar Law Firm website, their purposes and management methods are outlined below.

sections.title: 1. What Are Cookies?
body: Cookies are small text files stored on your browser by the websites you visit. They may be used to improve site performance, ensure security and remember your preferences.

sections.title: 2. Cookie Categories
body: We use the following cookie categories on our site:
list: Necessary Cookies: Required for secure sessions and core functionality. They cannot be disabled.
Analytics Cookies: Provide anonymous measurements for traffic and usage analysis. Default: Disabled. They are only activated with your consent.
Functional Cookies: Needed to display third-party services such as maps. Default: Disabled. They become active once you approve them.

sections.title: 3. Management
body: You may select your cookie preferences during your first visit. You can later update them via the “Cookie Preferences” link at the bottom of the page or manage cookies directly through your browser settings.

sections.title: 4. Retention
body: Cookie preferences are stored for 12 months from the date of your selection and renewed afterwards.

sections.title: 5. Updates
body: This policy may be revised due to legal or technical requirements. Updates take effect upon publication on our website.

veriSahibiBasvuru.title: Data Subject Application Process
veriSahibiBasvuru.description: Individuals whose data is processed may submit their requests regarding personal data in accordance with the PDPL (Law No. 6698) using the methods described below.

sections.title: 1. Application Methods
body: Applications may be submitted using the following methods:
list: In-person applications with a wet-ink signature
Applications submitted through a Registered Electronic Mail (KEP) address with secure electronic signature
Scanning the signed application and sending it with secure electronic signature to contact@kaynarhukuk.com

sections.title: 2. Required Information
body: Applications should include the following information:
list: Turkish ID number or passport number
Residential or workplace address for notification
If available, e-mail address, phone and fax for notification
Description of the request together with supporting information or documents

sections.title: 3. Response Time
body: Applications are finalised within 30 days under PDPL Article 13. Additional information may be requested depending on the nature of the request. Fees are determined in accordance with the PDPL and the Communiqué on the Principles and Procedures of Application to the Data Controller.

sections.title: 4. Rejection of the Application
body: If the request is rejected, a reasoned response is provided in writing or electronically. You may file a complaint with the Personal Data Protection Authority within 30 days of receiving our reply.

faqs.question: What does a lawyer do during the investigation stage?
faqs.answer: We attend interrogations, review the file and submit the necessary petitions to safeguard rights. Clients are kept informed at every step of the process.

faqs.question: What is the deadline for challenging detention?
faqs.answer: Objections must be filed within the time limits set out in the Criminal Procedure Code. A tailored plan is essential and urgent matters require swift action.

faqs.question: How long does the appeal process take?
faqs.answer: The duration depends on the workload of the Court of Cassation and the specifics of the case. Exact time frames cannot be guaranteed in advance.

faqs.question: Can you guarantee the outcome?
faqs.answer: Criminal litigation depends on many variables, so neither the result nor the timeline can be guaranteed. We do, however, present the most effective defense permitted by law.

faqs.question: How long does a divorce case take?
faqs.answer: Timelines depend on the court's workload, the scope of the file and the parties' approach. Uncontested divorces are resolved faster, but precise durations cannot be guaranteed.

faqs.question: Which documents are needed for an uncontested divorce?
faqs.answer: A marriage certificate, identification, the settlement protocol and, depending on the file, documents showing assets. A detailed checklist is shared beforehand.

faqs.question: Can custody decisions be changed later on?
faqs.answer: If new circumstances arise and the child's best interests require it, custody can be revisited. Supporting evidence such as social inquiry reports is important.

faqs.question: How is maintenance calculated?
faqs.answer: Courts consider the parties' financial standing, lifestyle, the child's needs and other statutory criteria. Every case is evaluated on its own facts.

faqs.question: When is mediation mandatory?
faqs.answer: For employee receivables and reinstatement claims, mediation is mandatory before filing a lawsuit. If mediation fails, a lawsuit may be filed with the final report.

faqs.question: What should a termination notice include?
faqs.answer: The reason for termination must be clear and specific, statutory notice periods must be observed, and required documents such as payrolls and employment certificates must be delivered.

faqs.question: What is the timeline for reinstatement claims?
faqs.answer: An employee must apply to mediation within one month of notification and file suit within two weeks if mediation fails. These deadlines are strict.

faqs.question: When does an employee earn severance pay?
faqs.answer: Severance is due if the employee has worked at least one year and the contract ends for qualifying reasons such as retirement, death, military service or employer termination.

faqs.question: Should company agreements be standardised?
faqs.answer: Every company has different needs. Template agreements can serve as a starting point, but most situations require tailoring to the sector and business model.

faqs.question: What are the critical steps in mergers and acquisitions?
faqs.answer: Financial and legal due diligence, contract negotiations, filings with the competition authority and post-closing integration are key.

faqs.question: How are commercial receivables pursued?
faqs.answer: We first consider settlement or restructuring; if that fails we commence enforcement or litigation, selecting the most suitable method for the case.

faqs.question: How can general-assembly resolutions be challenged?
faqs.answer: If resolutions breach the law or articles, shareholders may file for annulment or nullity within statutory time limits. Timing and evidence must be carefully managed.

faqs.question: How long does enforcement take?
faqs.answer: It depends on the nature of the proceedings, the debtor's attitude and the workload of the office. While no exact timeframe can be guaranteed, we keep the file under close follow-up.

faqs.question: How does the concordat process work?
faqs.answer: A petition and restructuring project are submitted; the court grants provisional relief and a commissioner oversees the process. Creditors' approval and court confirmation are required.

faqs.question: How is the debtor's asset position determined?
faqs.answer: We rely on official records, formal inquiries and, where needed, court-ordered discovery. Illegal means are never used; we act strictly within the law.

faqs.question: Can enforcement be opposed?
faqs.answer: Debtors may object within seven days of service. The creditor may then seek removal of the objection or file a lawsuit.

faqs.question: How critical are deadlines in administrative cases?
faqs.answer: The Administrative Procedure Law imposes strict deadlines. Actions generally must be filed within 30 or 60 days of service. Missing a deadline can lead to dismissal.

faqs.question: What is a stay of execution?
faqs.answer: It temporarily halts the execution of an administrative act. It may be granted when irreparable harm and serious indications of illegality exist, preventing enforcement until a final decision.

faqs.question: Is an administrative application mandatory before suing?
faqs.answer: Certain matters—such as some tax and customs disputes—require a preliminary administrative application. The applicable legislation is assessed for each case.

faqs.question: What are the time limits for procurement objections?
faqs.answer: Under the Public Procurement Law, objections must be filed within ten days. Decisions by the Public Procurement Authority may be challenged before administrative courts within thirty days.

faqs.question: When can an eviction lawsuit be filed?
faqs.answer: Statutory eviction grounds are limited, such as non-payment of rent, improper use or demolition. Each file is evaluated according to its circumstances.

faqs.question: How are rent increases calculated?
faqs.answer: Annual increases are determined by the Code of Obligations and contractual provisions. The law sets a ceiling and increases above that ceiling are invalid.

faqs.question: How can a tenant challenge an eviction order?
faqs.answer: Appeals can be filed within statutory time limits after service of the decision. It is crucial to observe deadlines and obtain legal advice.

faqs.question: What happens when the lease term ends?
faqs.answer: The tenant must vacate at the end of the term. Legal procedures must be observed—an eviction lawsuit may be required to enforce the decision.

faqs.answer: Clauses are determined by the parties' positions, legislation and risk analysis. Standard lists rarely cover every scenario; each contract requires bespoke assessment.

faqs.question: How should the negotiation process be structured?
faqs.answer: We prioritise key issues, analyse the counterparty's expectations and maintain thorough meeting notes, making use of professional negotiation techniques.

faqs.question: What happens if inconsistencies are found?
faqs.answer: Relevant clauses are revised, alternative arrangements are proposed and, where needed, supplemental protocols are prepared. Regulatory compliance remains paramount.

faqs.question: What if a contract is breached?
faqs.answer: Depending on the breach, compensation, termination or specific performance claims may be filed. Liquidated damages and compensation requests are assessed in light of the contract.

faqs.question: How does arbitration differ from court litigation?
faqs.answer: Parties appoint the tribunal, the process remains confidential and is generally more flexible. Arbitral awards are easier to enforce internationally under the New York Convention.

faqs.question: Can foreign court decisions be recognised in Türkiye?
faqs.answer: Recognition and enforcement follow international treaties or reciprocity principles. Each decision undergoes a specific review; recognition is not automatic.

faqs.question: Which law governs international contracts?
faqs.answer: The governing law is determined by the parties' choice or the system most closely connected to the contract. Choosing the applicable law is a strategic step.

faqs.question: May foreigners acquire real estate in Türkiye?
faqs.answer: Foreigners may acquire property subject to reciprocity and statutory limitations. Restrictions apply in military and special-security zones.

faqs.answer: Vertical restraints (distribution, dealership), exclusivity and resale price maintenance may pose risks. A case-by-case analysis is required.
